[[File:Artist's impression of the planet Ross 128 b.jpg|thumb|left|Artist's impression of the planet [[Ross 128 b]], with the star Ross 128 visible in the background<ref name=eso/>]]
Ross 128 b was discovered in July 2017 by the [[High Accuracy Radial Velocity Planet Searcher|HARPS]] instrument at the [[La Silla Observatory]] in Chile, by measuring changes in [[radial velocity]] of the host star. Its existence was confirmed on 15 November 2017. It is the second-closest known Earth-size exoplanet, after [[Proxima Centauri b|Proxima b]].<ref name="Atlantic">{{cite web|last1=Koren|first1=Marina|title=An Earth-Sized Exoplanet in Our Cosmic Neighborhood|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/science/archive/2017/11/ross-128-planet-discovered/545852/|website=The Atlantic|date=15 November 2017|publisher=The Atlantic Monthly Group.|access-date=15 November 2017}}</ref> Ross 128 b has a [[minimum mass]] 1.4 times that of Earth; a 2019 study predicts a true mass about 1.8 times Earth and a radius about 1.6 times that of the Earth, with large margins of error.<ref name="TaskerLaneuville2020"/> It orbits 20 times closer to its star than Earth orbits the Sun, intercepting only about 1.38 times more solar radiation than Earth,<ref name="4-planet"/><ref>[https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-41995572 Nearby planet is 'excellent' target in search for life]. Paul Rincon, ''BBC News''. 15 November 2017.</ref> increasing the chance of retaining an atmosphere over a geological timescale. Ross 128 b is a closely orbiting planet, with a year (orbital period) lasting about 9.9 days.<ref name="1-planet">{{cite journal |last=Bonfils |first=Xavier |title=A temperate exo-Earth around a quiet M dwarf at 3.4 parsecs |journal=[[Astronomy and Astrophysics]] |date=2017 |volume=613 |pages=A25 |doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201731973|arxiv=1711.06177 |bibcode=2018A&A...613A..25B |s2cid=37148632 }}</ref><ref name='AstronomyMag'>[http://www2.astronomy.com/news/2017/11/a-potentially-habitable-planet-11-light-years-away A potentially habitable planet has been discovered just 11 light-years away] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180221031045/http://www2.astronomy.com/news/2017/11/a-potentially-habitable-planet-11-light-years-away |date=2018-02-21 }}. John Wenz, ''Astronomy Magazine''. 15 November 2017.</ref> At that close distance from its host star, the planet is most likely [[Tidal locking|tidally locked]], meaning that one side of the planet would have eternal daylight and the other would be in darkness.<ref name=Locked>[https://science.howstuffworks.com/nearby-earth-sized-alien-world-orbits-quiet-star-boosting-habitable-potential.htm Nearby Earth-sized Alien World Orbits 'Quiet' Star, Boosting Habitable Potential]. Ian O'Neill, ''How Stuff Works''. 15 November 2017. Quote: ''"Tidal lock[ing] is expected for Ross 128 b," says Nicola Astudillo-Defru, who works at the Geneva Observatory, University of Geneva in Switzerland, and is co-author of the study.''</ref><ref>[http://www.solstation.com/stars/ross128.htm Ross 128]. ''Sol Station''. November 2017.</ref> Near-infrared high-resolution spectra from [[Sloan Digital Sky Survey#APO Galactic Evolution Experiment (APOGEE)|APOGEE]] have demonstrated that Ross 128 has near solar metallicity; Ross 128 b therefore most likely contains rock and iron. Furthermore, recent models generated with these data support the conclusion that Ross 128 b is a "temperate exoplanet in the inner edge of the habitable zone."<ref>{{Cite journal|last1=Souto|first1=Diogo|last2=Unterborn|first2=Cayman T.|last3=Smith|first3=Verne V.|last4=Cunha|first4=Katia|last5=Teske|first5=Johanna|last6=Covey|first6=Kevin|last7=Brbara Rojas-Ayala|last8=Garca-Hernndez|first8=D. Line 33: Line 33:
In the meantime, she takes measures to protect herself, assembling a trusted staff with the assistance of her azi bodyguards and companions, Florian and Catlin. When she discovers that her new azi security chief has been tampered with, her list of possible enemies grows to include key men inside Reseune itself: Yanni Schwartz, the Director, and Adam Hicks, the head of security. Adding to the discord is the return of a bitter Jordan Warrick from a twenty-year exile at an isolated research facility. He had been pressured into confessing to killing the original Emory.
In the meantime, she takes measures to protect herself, assembling a trusted staff with the assistance of her azi bodyguards and companions, Florian and Catlin. When she discovers that her new azi security chief has been tampered with, her list of possible enemies grows to include key men inside Reseune itself: Yanni Schwartz, the Director, and Adam Hicks, the head of security. Adding to the discord is the return of a bitter Jordan Warrick from a twenty-year exile at an isolated research facility. He had been pressured into confessing to killing the original Emory.


The murder of Dr. Sandur Patil, a top scientist recruited by Schwartz to head up the [[terraforming]] of Eversnow,{{#tag:ref|Eversnow is a frozen Union planet accessible from the Fargone space station.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.solstation.com/cjc/eversnow.htm |title=Eversnow |publisher= Meetpoint Station |access-date=March 29, 2015}}</ref>|group="nb"}} turns out to be but one step in a plot by Emory's unknown enemy that shakes Union to its core. As she struggles to deal with the escalating situation, she also unravels the decades-old mystery of her genemother's death.
The murder of Dr. Sandur Patil, a top scientist recruited by Schwartz to head up the [[terraforming]] of Eversnow,{{#tag:ref|Eversnow is a frozen Union planet accessible from the Fargone space station.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.solstation.com/cjc/eversnow.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090720113231/http://www.solstation.com/cjc/eversnow.htm |url-status=dead |archive-date=July 20, 2009 |title=Eversnow |publisher= Meetpoint Station |access-date=March 29, 2015}}</ref>|group="nb"}} turns out to be but one step in a plot by Emory's unknown enemy that shakes Union to its core. As she struggles to deal with the escalating situation, she also unravels the decades-old mystery of her genemother's death.

=== Bandit Heeler ===
=== Bandit Heeler ===
{{main|Bandit Heeler}}
{{main|Bandit Heeler}}
'''Bandit Custard Heeler'''<ref name="brownybear">{{Cite episode |title=[[List of Bluey episodes#Minisodes|Browny Bear]] |series=Bluey |series-link=Bluey (TV series) |network=[[ABC Kids (Australia)|ABC Kids]] |season=Minisodes 2 |credits=Writer: Joe Brumm |airdate=4 October 2024}}</ref> is a Blue Heeler who is the husband of Chilli, and the father of Bluey and Bingo, whom he enjoys playing with. He takes any role he plays in a game they devise seriously despite often being seen as reluctant and unwilling to partake in their games. He often teaches life lessons to his daughters while he plays with them, but this strains his relationship with them in some episodes. He is voiced by [[David McCormack]], the frontman of the [[Brisbane]]-based rock group [[Custard (band)|Custard]].<ref name="McF">McFarlane [https://web.archive.org/web/20040823035354/http://www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=248 'Custard'] entry. Retrieved 23 February 2010.</ref><ref name="SpencerDavidM">Spencer et al, (2007) [http://www.whiteroom.com.au/howlspace/whoswho/PHPMuso.php?categorywho=musos&userasks=38848 McCormack, David]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} entry. Retrieved 23 February 2010.</ref>
'''Bandit Custard Heeler'''<ref name="brownybear">{{Cite episode |title=[[List of Bluey episodes#Minisodes|Browny Bear]] |series=Bluey |series-link=Bluey (TV series) |network=[[ABC Kids (Australia)|ABC Kids]] |season=Minisodes 2 |credits=Writer: Joe Brumm |airdate=4 October 2024}}</ref> is a Blue Heeler who is the husband of Chilli, the father of Bluey and Bingo and the younger brother of Radley and Stripe. whom he enjoys playing with. He takes any role he plays in a game they devise seriously despite often being seen as reluctant and unwilling to partake in their games. He often teaches life lessons to his daughters while he plays with them, but this strains his relationship with them in some episodes. He is voiced by [[David McCormack]], the frontman of the [[Brisbane]]-based rock group [[Custard (band)|Custard]].<ref name="McF">McFarlane [https://web.archive.org/web/20040823035354/http://www.whammo.com.au/encyclopedia.asp?articleid=248 'Custard'] entry. Retrieved 23 February 2010.</ref><ref name="SpencerDavidM">Spencer et al, (2007) [http://www.whiteroom.com.au/howlspace/whoswho/PHPMuso.php?categorywho=musos&userasks=38848 McCormack, David]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} entry. The Professional Development League, sometimes known as the Professional Development League 2, is Under-21 football's second tier, designed for those academies with Category 2 status. The league, previously split regionally into north and south divisions, is now a single table with teams playing a geographically-aligned fixture schedule. The sides finishing in the top eight positions in both regions at the end of the season will progress to a playoff stage against Premier League 2 opposition. [[Brentford F.C. Reserves and Academy|Brentford U21s]] are the defending champions.

==Promotion and release==
==Promotion and release==
The song was originally only released as part of the album in February 2009, and was not a single. However, after gaining overwhelming popularity among fans, it was re-released as a radio airplay single over five years later on September 29, 2014.<ref name=FMQBSub>{{cite web|url=http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=40076|title=FMQB Airplay Archive: SubModern Rock|publisher=Friday Morning Quarterback Album Report, Incorporated|access-date=February 5, 2026|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161130231405/http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=40076|archive-date=November 30, 2016|df=mdy-all|url-status=dead}}</ref> It was included in the ''[[Rock Band (videogame)|Rock Band]]'' video game in downloadable mode.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rockband.com/songs/artists/A+Day+to+Remember |title=A Day to Remember // Songs // Rock Band |publisher=Rockband.com |access-date=March 6, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110116202647/http://www.rockband.com/songs/artists/A%20Day%20to%20Remember |archive-date=January 16, 2011 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In 2019, it surpassed 100 million plays on [[Spotify]], making it the most listened to song by the band on that platform.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.altpress.com/news/a-day-to-remember-if-it-means-a-lot-to-you-streams/|title=This A Day To Remember Classic Just Hit A Huge Milestone|publisher=[[Alternative Press (magazine)|Alternative Press]]|access-date=March 4, 2019}}</ref>
The song was originally only released as part of the album in February 2009, and was not a single. However, after gaining overwhelming popularity among fans, it was re-released as a radio airplay single over five years later on September 29, 2014.<ref name=FMQBSub>{{cite web|url=http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=40076|title=FMQB Airplay Archive: SubModern Rock|publisher=Friday Morning Quarterback Album Report, Incorporated|access-date=February 5, 2026|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161130231405/http://www.fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=40076|archive-date=November 30, 2016|df=mdy-all|url-status=dead}}</ref> It was included in the ''[[Rock Band (videogame)|Rock Band]]'' video game in downloadable mode.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rockband.com/songs/artists/A+Day+to+Remember |title=A Day to Remember // Songs // Rock Band |publisher=Rockband.com |access-date=March 6, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110116202647/http://www.rockband.com/songs/artists/A%20Day%20to%20Remember |archive-date=January 16, 2011 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In 2019, it surpassed 100 million plays on [[Spotify]], making it the most listened to song by the band on that platform.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.altpress.com/news/a-day-to-remember-if-it-means-a-lot-to-you-streams/|title=This A Day To Remember Classic Just Hit A Huge Milestone|publisher=[[Alternative Press (magazine)|Alternative Press]]|access-date=March 4, 2019}}</ref>

Line 77: Line 77:


==== Consecutive vs Simultaneous Interpreting ====
==== Consecutive vs Simultaneous Interpreting ====
Consecutive interpreting occurs when a time gap exists between the receipt of the source language to the moment the target language is delivered. This could be measured in seconds or even minutes. Contrast this with translation which may occur over a much longer time frame and involve much deeper processes to accurately provide meaning equivalence in the target language. Consider the translation of religious texts where the source text may have been written hundreds of years before the target text. Simultaneous interpreting on the other hand is considered to be more real-time. Due to the auditory influence of spoken languages consecutive interpreting is often a preferred method of service provision for spoken language interpreters. The [[Nuremberg trials]] after World War II was a significant event that changed the nature of spoken language interpreting services. Until then, simultaneous interpreting in a spoken language context was not applied but due to the complexity of the trial and the number of languages and language pairs being used, simultaneous interpreting was successfully implemented on a large and dynamic scale making it a defining moment in spoken language interpreting provision.
Consecutive interpreting occurs when a time gap exists between the receipt of the source language to the moment the target language is delivered. This could be measured in seconds or even minutes. Contrast this with translation which may occur over a much longer time frame and involve much deeper processes to accurately provide meaning equivalence in the target language. Consider the translation of religious texts where the source text may have been written hundreds of years before the target text. Simultaneous interpreting on the other hand is considered to be more real-time. Due to the auditory influence of spoken languages consecutive interpreting is often a preferred method of service provision for spoken language interpreters. The [[Nuremberg trials]] after [[World War II]] was a significant event that changed the nature of spoken language interpreting services. Until then, simultaneous interpreting in a spoken language context was not applied but due to the complexity of the trial and the number of languages and language pairs being used, simultaneous interpreting was successfully implemented on a large and dynamic scale making it a defining moment in spoken language interpreting provision.


In ASL-English interpreting, ASL is, for the most part, silent and therefore does not readily interfere with the reception or production of the spoken language. With one language consuming a different mode, space is created to allow for the reception or production of the spoken language; however, simultaneous interpreting is not always the preferred method and careful attention needs to be applied by the practitioner to the task immediately before them. It is often preferable to consider the simultaneous-consecutive dichotomy as a continuum in which the interpreter possesses the ability to flow between the two extremes.
In ASL-English interpreting, ASL is, for the most part, silent and therefore does not readily interfere with the reception or production of the spoken language. With one language consuming a different mode, space is created to allow for the reception or production of the spoken language; however, simultaneous interpreting is not always the preferred method and careful attention needs to be applied by the practitioner to the task immediately before them. It is often preferable to consider the simultaneous-consecutive dichotomy as a continuum in which the interpreter possesses the ability to flow between the two extremes.

Call]], and [[Archibald Yell]] (''The American Almanac'', 1833)|left]]
Samuel Gwin was appointed to the newly created land office at [[Chocchuma, Mississippi]], near the [[Yalobusha River]], and he died from wounds received in a duel with Mississippi judge [[Isaac Caldwell]] over the matter.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Anderson |first=Douglas |date=1921-09-04 |title=The Fighting Gwins of Fountain Head, Part V |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/nashville-banner-the-fighting-gwins-of-f/170627216/ |access-date=2025-04-28 |work=Nashville Banner |volume=XLVI|issue=148|location=Nashville, Tennessee|department=Section II: SportsClassifiedsOther News}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=1836-02-11 |title=Fatal Duel |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/richmond-enquirer-fatal-duel/190599711/ |access-date=2026-02-05 |work=Richmond Enquirer |pages=4}}</ref>{{efn|Caldwell, who was Poindexter's law partner, was killed immediately; Gwin was shot through the lung and died two years later in New Orleans of a pulmonary complaint.<ref>{{Cite news |date=1836-02-10 |title=Fatal Duel |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/wyoming-republican-and-herald-fatal-duel/190599787/ |access-date=2026-02-04 |work=Wyoming Republican and Herald |pages=3}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=1838-08-03 |title=Col. Samuel Gwin of Mississippi |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/the-weekly-mississippian-col-samuel-gwi/190601362/ |access-date=2026-02-05 |work=The Weekly Mississippian |pages=3}}</ref>}} Samuel's brother [[William M. Gwin|William McKendree Gwin]] became influential during the [[Presidency of Martin Van Buren|Martin Van Buren administration]] and was eventually elevated to the U.S. Senate.{{Sfnp|Rohrbough|1971|p=279}} The sale of public land at the Chocchuma land office was investigated by the [[U.S. Congress]]:{{sfnp|Gates|1968|p=152}}
Samuel Gwin was appointed to the newly created land office at [[Chocchuma, Mississippi]], near the [[Yalobusha River]], and he died from wounds received in a duel with Mississippi judge [[Isaac Caldwell]] over the matter.<ref>{{Cite news |date=1888-01-31 |title=Southern Duels |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/the-weekly-telegraph-southern-duels/164429989/ |access-date=2026-02-06 |work=The Weekly Telegraph |pages=8}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Anderson |first=Douglas |date=1921-09-04 |title=The Fighting Gwins of Fountain Head, Part V |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/nashville-banner-the-fighting-gwins-of-f/170627216/ |access-date=2025-04-28 |work=Nashville Banner |volume=XLVI|issue=148|location=Nashville, Tennessee|department=Section II: SportsClassifiedsOther News}}</ref>{{efn|Caldwell, who was Poindexter's former law partner, was killed immediately; Gwin was shot through the lung and died two years later in New Orleans.<ref>{{Cite news |date=1836-02-10 |title=Fatal Duel |url=https://www.newspapers.com/article/wyoming-republican-and-herald-fatal-duel/190599787/ |access-date=2026-02-04 |work=Wyoming Republican and Herald |pages=3}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=1838-08-03 |title=Col. Gwin|William McKendree Gwin]] became influential during the [[Presidency of Martin Van Buren|Martin Van Buren administration]] and was eventually elevated to the U.S. Senate.{{Sfnp|Rohrbough|1971|p=279}} The sale of public land at the Chocchuma land office was investigated by the [[U.S. Congress]]:{{sfnp|Gates|1968|p=152}}


{{blockquote|text=... which revealed that although members of Congress, the chief justice of the Court of Appeals of Mississippi, and the federal marshal were present, no one could recall that the provisions of the Act of 1830 had been read, as required by the instructions of the Commissioner of the Land Office, or that there had been protests against the clearly illegal actions of the combinations. It was also brought out that the register, Samuel Gwin, had left his office to buy some tracts and had resold them immediately at a 33 percent profit to settlers, but the only unusual feature of his conduct is that he was induced to admit his dereliction.{{sfnp|Gates|1968|p=152}}}}

It was also brought out that the register, Samuel Gwin, had left his office to buy some tracts and had resold them immediately at a 33 percent profit to settlers, but the only unusual feature of his conduct is that he was induced to admit his dereliction.{{sfnp|Gates|1968|p=152}}}}

The '''Beck Building''' is a {{convert|265|ft|m|abbr=on}} tall historic office building located on '''400 Travis Street''' in downtown [[Shreveport, Louisiana]]. The building has 20 floors and was built from 1955 to 1957. Upon the building's completion, it became the tallest building in Shreveport; it also became the first commercial office high-rise in [[northern Louisiana]]. In 1984, it was surpassed by the {{convert|302|ft|m|abbr=on}} tall [[Louisiana Tower (Shreveport, Louisiana)|Louisiana Tower]]. As of February 2026, it is the 3rd-tallest building in the city, with the [[Louisiana Tower (Shreveport, Louisiana)|Louisiana Tower]] and [[Regions Tower]] being the only buildings taller than it.
The '''Beck Building''' is a {{convert|265|ft|m|abbr=on}} tall historic office building located on '''400 Travis Street''' in downtown [[Shreveport, Louisiana]]. The building has 20 floors and was built from 1955 to 1957. Upon its completion, it became the tallest building in Shreveport; it also became the first commercial office high-rise in [[northern Louisiana]]. In 1984, it was surpassed by the {{convert|302|ft|m|abbr=on}} tall [[Louisiana Tower (Shreveport, Louisiana)|Louisiana Tower]]. As of February 2026, it is the 3rd-tallest building in the city, with the [[Louisiana Tower (Shreveport, Louisiana)|Louisiana Tower]] and [[Regions Tower]] being the only buildings taller than it.


The building was built to be a major office building for the local oil refining and pipeline industry.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Henry C. Beck Building - LoopNet|publisher=LoopNet|url=https://images3.loopnet.com/d2/OWXFmDtLy0PpQLBpp3Be07NzRdc2_NYEZxEdtfaSdxk/document.pdf}}</ref> There is a chapel on the 2nd floor of the building, which is open for people to come and pray and worship.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Patton|first=Devon|date=2016-12-02|title=A Shreveport chapel in the sky - KTBS 3|publisher=KTBS 3|url=https://www.ktbs.com/news/a-shreveport-chapel-in-the-sky/article_6b7d2c35-3918-5822-bbb5-51435cb3a228.html}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Henry C. Beck Building - Estep & Associates|publisher=Estep & Assocaites|url=https://estepassociates.com/listings/henry-c-beck-building/}}</ref> Notable tenants include [[Burns & McDonnell]], the Community Bank of Louisiana, and the Louisiana Oil & Gas Association.<ref>{{Cite web|title=400 Travis St, Shreveport, LA - Usearch|publisher=Usearch|url=https://usearch.com/property/400-travis-st-shreveport-la#tenants}}</ref>
The building was built to be a major office building for the local oil refining and pipeline industry.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Henry C. Beck Building - Estep & Associates|publisher=Estep & Assocaites|url=https://estepassociates.com/listings/henry-c-beck-building/}}</ref> Notable tenants include [[Burns & McDonnell]], the Community Bank of Louisiana, and the Louisiana Oil & Gas Association.<ref>{{Cite web|title=400 Travis St, Shreveport, LA - Usearch|publisher=Usearch|url=https://usearch.com/property/400-travis-st-shreveport-la#tenants}}</ref>
